answers.answer: Discuss it with your husband.  I think that if you want to try and get pregnant when he comes back for r&r then do it.  It would be a wonderful gift for him to come home to another child.  When will he be back for good?  Not to sound bad or anything, but there is no 100% guarantee that he will come back, and if you want one now, you should try.  I know that sounds so wrong to say, and I am so very sorry if I have offended you.  But like I said, discuss it with him, and see what he says.  I wish you the best of luck.  (also- tell your hubby thank you for doing what he does.  I feel blessed that we have so many people that are willing to go over there.  You are very lucky to have him.  My hubby wanted to go, but he developed type 1 diabetes so he cant. They wont take him.)God bless you and your family.

question: I have had a Mirena IUD in place for almost 3 years now. My husband and I had talked about bringing another child into the picture since our first is about to be 4 but then he came down on deployment orders and is now in Iraq. He gets his r & r in April and I have an appointment the end of January to have my IUD removed. Am I asking too much to try and get pregnant in April or would it be more conceivable to plan on getting pregnant when he gets back for good?I know that with the paragard IUD, you can get pregnant almost as soon as it comes out because there is no hormonal influence but  I am not sure if it is the same with the Mirena....HEP!!!!!!!!!!!!
title: Making Plans to Further My Family
